description: You feel okay. But the bite still delivers 1 point of damage. gusts into the passage where you are, blowing out Jozan’s torch.
name: DM

description: Ouch. Okay, then I roll a 14 to grab it and throw it to the Tordek: Do I see anything with my darkvision? ground. Do I succeed? DM: Beyond the door is a chamber with rough walls, not blocks
name: Mialee

description: Yes. The spider lands on the ground and looks like it’s of stone like the room behind you. It’s 25 feet wide and extends going to scuttle away, perhaps back up the wall to the webs above. about 40 feet to the south. A stream spills through the room into a
name: DM

description: My turn. I run up to it and smash it with my mace! I roll pool, carrying with it a cold, damp breeze. You don’t see anything a natural 20! With my bonus, that’s 22 in all. moving around, but some old barrels and buckets are here.
name: Jozan

description: Good roll! You can move that far and attack, so make a roll Jozan: I cast lighton a rock, since we’ll never get a torch lit in to see if that’s a critical hit. this wind.
name: DM

description: [Excitedly rolling again.] Is a 15 good enough? DM: Okay, now everyone can see.
name: Jozan

description: Yep. Roll damage—twice. Add the results together. Tordek: I look at the ceiling and the floor for any more nasty
name: DM

description: [Rolls.] Sweet! Twelve points altogether once I add my surprises. Strength bonus—which also doubled with the crit! Mialee: I’ll look in the barrels and buckets.
name: Jozan

description: Okay. First, make another Fort save to see if there are any ting into it, but you can look into the water to spot anything that lingering effects from that spider bite. might be there. [The players comply and tell the DM their results,
name: DM

description: Uh-oh, that doesn’t sound good . . . [Rolls.] . . . a 17! although the DM knows that there’s nothing for Tordek or Mialee to find.]
name: Mialee

The males are noticeably taller and heavier than the ò A Vasharan receives 4 extra skill points at 1st level and 1 females. Vasharan skin shades range from fair to very pale, extra skill point at each additional level. Like humans, their hair is straight and black, and the men generally have they are versatile and capable. (The 4 skill points at first facial hair. Like humans, Vasharans have short life spans, level are added on as a bonus, not multiplied in.) achieving adulthood at about age 15 and rarely living ò Automatic Language: Common. description: A Jerren typically chooses a name that helps her Example: Trendan Resh (NE male human Ftr2/Rog4) is a make the impression she wants to make. If she wants to be criminal who has lived all his life in the big city. Since his known for slaying the kin of her enemies, she chooses a youth, Trendan has run a small gang of other young toughs. name such as Kinslayer. If she wants to be known as a None of them seek gainful employmentùthey would terror to all she meets, she picks a name such as Blood- rather waylay visitors to the city or steal from the drunks in spray. the alleyways behind Tavern Row. Trendan is cowardly, lazy,
name: Names

description: Narma Glitterhome (CE female gnome Wiz8) be a foppish rogue without a conscience or a dispassionate serves as a butler to Lord Feddin Spritestar, a powerful and overlord who enjoys a sampling of fine elven wines while influential gnome. What most people do not realize is that watching the execution of prisoners. Narma has the lordÆs ear and frequently gives him advice Sophisticated villains are sometimes the evildoers that no about the rulership of his demesne. But Lord Spritestar does one suspects. Only a thorough investigation can prove their not know that Narma is manipulating him into a war against terrible deeds. Urbane villains are able to convince most the nearby kobold tribes of Bloodwall. people that they are noble, civilized individuals. In other Narma is an illusionist who frequently travels to Blood- cases, these villains are known for what they truly are, but wall in the guise of a male kobold to manipulate the council they still believe themselves to be cultured and sophisti- of chieftains there. If war breaks out, Narma is poised to cated, and they conduct themselves accordinglyùeven as assume a third identity: the long-lost gnome queen Halli they commit atrocities.
name: Example

description: Duchess Winsone DÆArtreda (LE female human and become ruler of the land. Ari13) rules over a vast, wooded realm. All know her as a beau- Narma wears a ring precious to her, the ring of many faces, tiful, well-mannered, and sophisticated woman. Unknown to which grants her the use of polymorph selfthree times per day most, however, she is also a sadist and a cold-blooded killer. and a +10 profane bonus on her Disguise checks. She has a secret set of chambers in the dungeons below her castle where she keeps her victims. Winsone has a strange
name: Guttenstone, who will save the gnomes from the kobolds Example
